fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, the *Space directory* is empty preventing users from accessing spaces through it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Space directory*

h3. Expected Results
The *Space directory* lists all visible spaces to the user.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed in the *Space directory* even with the proper permissions.
 
h3.Workaround
Contact Atlassian Cloud support so we can run a content re-indexing on your Confluence Cloud instance which will fix the issue
fields.summary: Space directory is empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For new look and feel: comment section is missing for a page that has large amount of comments (more than 150 comments).

h3. Environment
1000.0.0-c5a9e98

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you are using new look and feel.
# Create a page
# Create 150 comments or more
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

Comment section should be shown properly.

h3. Actual Results

Comment section is missing.

h3. Notes
If you try to access comment section using some link (e.g. notification link from e-mail), comments will be displayed wrongly or not displayed at all.

h3.Workaround
n/a
fields.summary: Comment section of a page is missing for new look and feel if there is a large amount of comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Markup Macro doesn't work on Published Pages

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page and Publish it
# Edit the Page
# Insert a Markup Macro
# Put any text on the field 
# Click 'Insert'

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be inserted on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The pop-up macro goes blank and freezes.
fields.summary: Markup Macro doesn't work on Published Pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a Space with the same key as other Space which you don't permissions to View doesn't trigger any errors

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Space
# Remove all permissions (personal and groups) from it
# Try to create another space with the same key

h3. Expected Behavior
It should trigger an error stating that there's another space with the same key.

h3. Actual Behavior
Nothing happens. No notification is triggered neither the space is created.
fields.summary: Creating a Space with the same key as other Space which you don't have permissions to View doesn't trigger any errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence New Look, the tasks macro in Page Property Report are missing styling. For example, the dates no longer show up in different colors for past due, upcoming, and long term. Tasks show up as a bullet point instead of a checkbox.
h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Page Property Report macro
 # Include tasks report

h3. Expected Results

Formatting should remain the same, including various colors for state of tasks, and checkboxes.
h3. Actual Results

Formatting appears to be missing, tasks do not have checkboxes
  
h3.  
h3. Workaround

No current workaround in Confluence New Look
fields.summary: Page Property Report Macro Tasks styling missing in Confluence New Look

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a colleague answers a Confluence Question, which shows up in the "all activity feed", the link created to the question will not function properly and will result in a page not found page and *no 404 return code* error. The URL in the bar will change to the correct url and reloading the page will make the question show up.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a question in confluence questions
# ask a colleague to answer the question for you so that it shows up in your "all activity" feed
# Find the action in the activity feed and click the link to the Confluence Question.

h3. Expected Results

The Page for the Question opens.

h3. Actual Results

- Browser runs a GET request to a URL like:
/wiki/rest/shortcuts/latest/shortcuts/6452/4678807f1f78cc00b046b9170b384f08
- Browser changes the URL in the navigation bar to the correct URL.
- "Page Not Found" page is displayed instead of the expected page.
 
h3. Notes
Opening the link in a new tab or window works normally.
Reloading the page works normally
The link will work normally if you link it with a space when you create it. Linking it with a space after creation does not seem to have any impact and the link will still fail.

h3.Workarounds
Options are:
- Reload the page.
- Open in new tab.
- Open in new window.
- Link a space to the question when you create it.
fields.summary: Links to Confluence Questions found in the activity feed give a not found

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Pasting a link to the same page can under some circumstances create a link that does nothing.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Copy and paste the url of the page into the page to create a link macro. This may not cause the issue. if not go to step 3.
# create a link macro and paste the URL into the weblink URL and add some custom text.
# Publish the page and then click the link.

h3. Expected Results

The link causes the page to reload.

h3. Actual Results

The link will do nothing and will not trigger any action in the browser.

 
h3. Notes

In some cases, the link will not be saved with the "ac:link" in the storage format.


h3.Workaround
Edit the link, and set the weblink to contain the URL of the page up to and including the page ID number, but excluding the page title.

for example a URL like this:
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KEY/pages/1234567/Title+of+Page

Will need to be pasted as:
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KEY/pages/1234567

Alternatively, you can put a table of contents macro on the bottom of the page given the following conditions:
- The page does not make use of headings.
- You only want the browser to return to the top of the article.
fields.summary: Some links to the same page do nothing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Copy-paste of a subset of a table in excel spreadsheet into confluence page editor exhibits strange behaviors in various scenarios depending on the context of the paste.



h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# open an excel spreadsheet and fill in some test data, then copy to clipboard
# Paste into a test confluence page

h3. Expected Results

a new table with the same content of the copied data is created where the data was pasted.

h3. Actual Results

- Pasting table into empty page appears to paste normally, however placing cursor by mouse in or out of the table does not work.
- Pasting the table into a page with text appears to paste the table as text. Confluence detects the table as a table, however the table editor options have no effect on the table when editing. Publishing the page will make the table appear normally.
- Pasting the table into a single cell of a new table appears to work normally and has no apparent negative effects
 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
- Best is to paste the data into a single cell of a new inserted table.
- alternatively, Publish the page, this will convert it to a proper table, then edit the page again.
fields.summary: Pasting selected cells from Excel into editor does not format data as a table until published

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding a "- " or a "* " after External Link on Bulleted List will remove the Bullet List formatting

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Page
# Create a Bulleted List with some external links (e.g. 'google.com')

 !1.png|thumbnail! 

# Add the end of one them, add a "*" or a "-" (without quotes) and hit space

h3. Expected Behavior

The list should keep the way it is.

 !2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Behavior

The line edited loses its 'bulleted list' format

 !3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adding a "- " or a "* " after External Link on Bulleted List will remove the Bullet List formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you upload an image with a transparent background and you change the image size in Confluence. The image will not display properly in Mozilla Firefox. The image will display correctly when using Google Chrome.

h3. Environment
Only affecting Unicorn instance
Confluence 1000.1821.0
Mozilla Firefox 54.0.1 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Insert an image with transparent background  !_thumb_2277668.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the size of the image from 64px to 49px
# Save the page
# Access the page using Mozilla Firefox

h3. Expected Results
* The image should display properly in Firefox

h3. Actual Results
* The image display is distorted in Firefox
fields.summary: Transparent background image doesn't display properly in Firefox

fields.description:
In Confluence, some macros use links to display content, like the [Children Display Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/children-display-macro-139501.html], but they always come with the default blue colour. 

This is a suggestion to have an option to change the colour of the hyperlinks only for macros.
fields.summary: Colours for Macro Links

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Site backup is unavailable due to _JDBCConnectionException_ especially if instance contains a large size of pages. This also occurs during large Space Exports and Space Imports. 

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Full Confluence Site Backup
 # Go to instance which has pages for 1000 MB+
 # Take site backup without attachments
 # Wait for around 10 hours
* Try Importing large Space into Confluence Cloud
* Try Exporting large Space from Confluence Cloud

h3. Expected Results
* Site backup will be successfully completed
* Space Export/Import to Complete

h3. Actual Results
 * Backup manager complains error:
{code:none}
Export error
Unexpected error during export has occurred
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2017-07-09T07:28:02.814+09:00
{code}
* Example Error Log:
{code}
Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.JDBCConnectionException: Unable to acquire JDBC Connection
{code}
* CPU and RAM usage significantly increased

h3. Notes
 * Exception itself is the same to --CONFCLOUD-55802--

h3. Workaround
* Try Space export
** However as this type of instances also tend to have large attachment size (such as 200 GB+/space) and site export doesn't support excluding attachment files, this workaround is not likely to be applicable
* Try Export/Import during lower Confluence Cloud usage
fields.summary: JDBCConnectionException - Confluence Site/Space Exports and Imports

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using some specific colors in the "Colour Scheme Settings" can cause the side bar to fail to load.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# change color for Text and icons to #FFFFFF
# Change color for Background to #343A41

h3. Expected Results

The color of the font and background change to the colors specified.

h3. Actual Results

The sidebar will not function (clicking does nothing) and will be grey:
 !Broken Sidebar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
Change the background color to another color. Adding "1" to the hex value will work. For example using  #343A42 will work, but  #343A41 causes the issue.
fields.summary: Some Specific Custom colors causes the sidebar to become non-functional

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Site Homepage" setting in the user configuration used to set which page should load when clicking on the Confluence site logo in the header. When the new space navigation is turned on, on initial load of Confluence the user is taken to the homepage, but subsequent clicks will return the user to the dashboard instead.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set the Confluence Site Homepage in the User Settings menu to a space (including the user's personal space).
 # Click the site logo in the header, note that you're taken to the specified space's homepage.
 # Turn on the new space navigation, click the site logo again.

h3. Expected results

You're taken to the space/page specified in the Configuration.
h3. Actual results

You're taken to the dashboard.
fields.summary: User Homepage not respected with new navigation enabled
Database Exhaustion During Import

Atlassian Support documentation page about Confluence Blog Post Macros is missing.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blog-posts-macro-724765162.html]
fields.summary: Blog Post Macro documentation page is missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using Internet Explorer 11 users are unable to paste content within the editor using Ctrl+V shortcut
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud with the new look and navigation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Confluence in the new look and navigation
 # Access it using IE11
 # Create or edit a page
 # While you're still in editor mode copy some content from elsewhere (like the notepad) using Ctrl+C
 # Try to paste it using Ctrl+V

h3. Expected Results

The content is pasted.
h3. Actual Results

The content isn't pasted.

The following error appears in the browser's console:
{code:java}
SCRIPT5007: Unable to get property 'getData' of undefined or null reference
atlassian-editor.min.js (19,18296)
{code}
h3. Workaround

Use Right click + Paste to paste the content.
fields.summary: Unable to paste content into the editor using IE11

fields.description:
h3.Summary
* Padlock icon restriction on inherited child pages show grey padlock.

h3.Environment
Cloud environment
Confluence 1000.1808.0

h3.Steps to reproduce
# On parent page restrict the page permission.
# Navigate to a page with inherited restriction page.

Expected Result
* On child page showing red padlock.

Actual Result
* On child page showing grey padlock.

Workaround
* No Workaround.
fields.summary: Padlock icon restriction on inherited child pages show grey padlock

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to import Word Document to Confluence Cloud using a word document with big image inside, an error was thrown.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit a page in Confluence Cloud
# Click on the menu and choose 'Import Word Document'
# Follow the steps and click import

h3. Expected Results
Word file successfully imported to the page

h3. Actual Results
* The following message is displayed:  !Apa AJA - Bamboo Tumpyl - Confluence-000209.png|thumbnail! 
* The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.wordimport.exception.ImageSizeException
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This only happened with word files with big images inside. In Confluence Server, there is a configuration to change the limit of how big can the image be, but there is no such option in Confluence Cloud. At the same time, we are unaware of what is the maximum size allowed.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Error when importing word document to Confluence with "Import failed! word.import.error.image.size" message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Viewing inherited page restrictions from the restrictions dialog doesn't work the second time the dialog is opened

h3. Environment
Cloud environment
 Confluence 1000.1808.0

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # On a parent page, add some restrictions
 # Navigate to a child page, which will have inherited restrictions
 # Open the Restrictions dialog via the lock icon
 # Click on the inherited view restrictions link (this opens a popup dialog showing the inherited restrictions)
 # Now click on the "Cancel" link to close the entire dialog (not the popup)
 # Open the Restrictions dialog again
 # Click on the inherited view restrictions link, this time it won't appear

Note that Step 4 is important. If the inherited restrictions link wasn't clicked the first time the dialog was opened, it will work in Step 7.

Expected Result
 * Clicking on the inherited view restrictions link should always open a popup

Actual Result
 * Clicking on the inherited view restrictions link only works on the first attempt

Workaround
 * Reload the page on the browser
fields.summary: View page restriction on inherited pages not working on the second attempt

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Checkboxes does not display correctly on Page Properties Report macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Add a *Page Property* macro and configure values as checkboxes.
 - !page property.png|thumbnail!
 - On another page, add a *Page Property Report* macro and report on the previously configured page.

h3. Expected Results

The values on the column should show the checkboxes correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The values on the column display bullet points instead of chechboxes.

The dates no longer show up in different colors for past due, upcoming, and long term. 

!Spage property report.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Checkbox cannot be displayed on Page Property Report macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Error rendering macro 'jira' : Macro params are invalid" error replaces Jira Issue table in Confluence when editing and publishing in Confluence Mobile iOS app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page or use an existing page
# add the Jira Issue macro into the page
# once added publish the page
# edit the page and re-publish
# The Jira Issue table where the jira issues are suppose to be shown would show *Error rendering macro 'jira' : Macro params are invalid* error instead of the JIRA issue table

h3. Expected Results
Page will be published without any errors

h3. Actual Results
The Jira Issue table where the jira issues are suppose to be shown would show *Error rendering macro 'jira' : Macro params are invalid* error instead of the JIRA issue table

h3.Workaround
Either remove and readd the Jira Issue macro from the web version of Confluence or revert to previous page history.
fields.summary: "Error rendering macro 'jira' : Macro params are invalid" error replaces Jira Issue table in Confluence when editing in Confluence Mobile iOS app

fields.description:
Hi there,

Confluence is really cool and I enjoy using it, but there is one HUGE drawback that I run into frequently.

The word processing functionality is klunky at best.  Trying to set up pages and templates, get the formatting, tabbing and bulleting right, etc, is way more hassle than it should be.  Even MSWord works a little more predictably than Confluence.  Fixing these issues to have a consistent logical interface would significantly improve the usefulness of Confluence for me.  (Here's a good example:  I have one bullet point with no text, but delete WILL NOT delete the bullet point.  Finally, I hit Enter and then the empty bullet gets deleted).

This is my biggest headache.  Otherwise, I love Confluence.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Lack of quality, predictable, natural word processing functionality is major drawback

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to export some spaces with lots of pages and attachments, using the "Custom Export" option could be used to avoid problematic pages if the space exports fail, however, for some Confluence instances the custom export renders an error "Error Loading Pages".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Via "Space tools" browse to "Content Tools" and click on tab "Export";
# Choose the export format and click "Next";
# Click on "Custom Export".

h3. Expected Results

The page tree is loaded and you are able to choose which pages to export.

h3. Actual Results

The page doesn't load and an error is rendered in the UI.

 !Screen Shot 2017-08-08 at 6.22.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround

None so far.

h3. Notes

Exporting to other formats could work.
fields.summary: When trying to export a Space using the custom export option "Error Loading Pages"

fields.description:
In Confluence, we can create different blueprints for different categories. Sometimes, the user might want to change the current blueprints used for his company, but, he already would have it created.

This is a suggestion to have a bundled function to migrate the content and have it adapted to the targeted blueprint.
fields.summary: Migration Between Blueprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you add a *JIRA Issue Date Event* to show the *Change Start Date* from a Service Desk project, it doesn't display the issues in Team Calendar. But when you add *Issue Created Date* and *Change Start Date*, it will display both the  
'Issue Created Date' and 'Change Start Date' of issues. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.1804.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk Project
# Create an issue with Change Start Date information 
# Add a Confluence Team Calendar 
# Add a JIRA event type on the Confluence Team Calendar
# Display the issues of the created project from Step 1
# Select to show *Change start date*
# Check if it will populate the Team Calendar showing the Change start date of issues

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA Issue Event to show Change Start Date should show the issues Change Start Date in Confluence Team Calendar

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA Issue Event to show Change Start Date is not showing the issues Change Start Date in Confluence Team Calendar

 
h3. Workaround
* Add 'Issue Created Date' together with the 'Change Start Date'
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Event to show Change Start Date is not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to [CONFCLOUD-45537|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45537], the image effects should be working as expected for now. However, when trying to add image effects, it's only displayed in the editor, while on the page, the image has no effects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *Edit* a new Confluence page
# *Insert* a new attachment (a picture, in this case)
# Add the requested effect by *clicking on the image > Properties > Effects*
# Notice that the effect will be applied.
# *Publish* the page

h3. Expected Results
The image should have the effect applied.

h3. Actual Results
No effects are applied. 
 
h3. Notes
Attached screenshots of the behavior:

!before.png|thumbnail! !after.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Image Effects not Working

fields.description:
h3.Summary
* Shortcut for Shift+Enter is not working on a newly created page.

h3.Environment
Cloud environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-5491414

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page on Confluence.
# Press Shift+Enter on first time (nothing happens)
# Press Shift+Enter on second time onwards the cursor will move to a new line.

Expected Result
* Press Shift+Enter on the first time the cursor will move to a new line.

Actual Result
* Press Shift+Enter on first time (nothing happens)

Workaround
* Publish the newly created page first and edit again the page.
fields.summary: Shortcut for Shift+Enter is not working on newly created page.

fields.description:
h3.Summary
* Show More on profile menu does not work

h3.Environment
Cloud environment

fields.description:
h3. Unable to Complete Tasks in a Task Report Macro and Unable to complete Tasks that exist on the same Page as a Task Report Macro

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud "New Look and Feel"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Page in Confluence which has a Task Report Macro and a few tasks (Page A)
- Create a Second Page in Confluence with a few Tasks (Page B)
- Ensure that Both Page A and Page B appear in the Task Report Macro
- Attempt to 'complete' a Task on Page A either:
-- by clicking on the Checkbox in the Task Report Macro
-- by clicking on the Checkbox directly associated to the Task

h3. Expected Results
The task checkmark box is checked and successfully completed.

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
"Oops! You can't update this task because you are not allowed to edit the page it appears on."
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Tasks on other pages which do not contain the Task Report macro can be checked off/completed 


h3.Workaround
- If the Tasks exists on a different page, Complete the Task directly (not through the Macro)
OR
- If the Task exists on the same page as the Task Report Macro, Edit the Page and complete the Task through the Editor
fields.summary: Unable to Complete Tasks with Task Macro

fields.description:
For our development team we like to keep track of our ideas and existing project structure.

Unfortunately we get some issues working with Confluence sometimes. One major issue is creating various pages with the same idea under a same page title:

*For example:*
 * Module X:
 ** Workflows
 ** Whiteboard images
 * Module Y:
 ** Workflows
 ** Whiteboard images
 * Module Z....
 ** ...

This structure is currently not supported with the confluence functionality. Is there any reason why? Or is it intentionally, that there should not be multiple pages with the same page title?

fields.description:
*Idea*

When searching for a content via label or add labels to a page or an attachment it would be amazing, when I get not only a plain list of used labels, but something like a label-cloud with labels, which are connected together like a network. So when I add the first label, I can surf through this connected label-map and add other connected labels to this record. Or when I search a content, I can surf through the global label-network in this manner.

Also when I browse a page, there should be not only listed the labels, but also connected labels. Something like at amazon the suggestions "user, bought this product, also bought...". And every visitor may via one click add a new connected label to this page or also delete a label, perhaps beacuse there is a new one, which is more precise.

*How to realize it*

Every time two labels are added at the same record, this connection will be count in the DB. The connection lines between the labels at label-network should be more and less thick, depending on the count of connections between it. (Like in our brain, when two synapses are often triggered together, there will be a new connection between them.) The labels may be bigger or smaller, depending on they using.

Maybe its usefull, if the thickness of connections is depending not only on common using, but also on surfing through the label-map. And maybe this function may have a forget-feature, so that the thickness of connections is depending on time, when the connection was done.

*Benefits*

When adding labels I have good suggestions for labels. When search a content I can use this dynamical organisation-structure. I have not only a Cloud of labels, but with a map of labels they have a relation together.
fields.summary: Synaptic labelling

The screen goes to the top of the editor.

Use Google Chrome.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-56302].
  {panel}
Summary
 * Edit the document using Atlassian Companion is not working on terminal server with multiple desktop session

Steps to reproduce
 # The first user tries to edit the document and receives a prompt to download and install the Atlassian Companion app which then gets installed into their user profile. And they can open the document correctly.
 # The second user logged on to the same Terminal Server tries to open a different document using Atlassian Companion (the second user will not be prompted to install the Atlassian Companion – instead the document will open on the first user’s desktop)
 # If the first user shuts down the Atlassian Companion by clicking Quit in its tray menu, the second user will now be prompted to download and install the Companion app and the second user able to open documents on their second user desktop.
 # If another user tries to edit a document using Atlassian Companion it will open on the second user’s desktop.

Environment
 * Operating System: Windows Server 2012 R2.
 * Microsoft Office version: Microsoft Office 2013.

Expected Result
 * Edit the document using Atlassian Companion will show on the same desktop session.

Actual Result
 * Edit the document using Atlassian Companion will show on the previous desktop session that using Atlassian Companion before.

Workaround
 * If the user already done using the Atlassian Companion to close the Atlassian Companion.

Notes: I can't reproduce-able the issue as we don't have the infrastructure to test.
fields.summary: Edit the document using Atlassian Companion is not working on terminal server with multiple desktop session

h2. Summary


User seeing "can view and edit* permission on the restriction page but they cannot edit the page.

h2. Steps to replicate

# Create a space with one user ("Bert", say), create a second user ("Suren") who has admin and restriction permission to edit pages in that space.
# Create a page in the new space, add page restrictions so only Bert can edit it (everyone else can view it though).
# Log in as Suren, bring up the Page Restrictions dialog on the newly-created page.


h3. Expected Results
The Page Restrictions dialog shows _only_ Bert as having edit permission and everyone else has view-only permission.

h3. Actual results
The Page Restrictions dialog confusingly shows Suren as having Edit permission despite there being no "Edit" button on the page.

h3. Workaround
None.

Confluence 1000.0.0-7374b6c

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and attach Word and Excel files
# Insert Office and Excel Macro 
# Publish the page

Edit Document option should be available when viewing an Office and Excel macro

h3. Actual Results
Edit Document option is not available when viewing an Office and Excel macro

h3. Note
* Edit file is visible in Attachment Macro but will not have an option to edit through Atlassian Companion app.

fields.summary: Spaces cannot be deleted if there are relations to their custom content entities

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Restricted Team Calendar is visible within the Activity Stream for all users within Confluence however it is not accessible except by those who are members of the restriction

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
For testing:
# Create a New Space or Edit an Existing Space and limit its Space Permissions to a single User (User A)
# Add a Team Calendar and set restrictions to User A
# Login as another user (User B) and view the Activity Stream on the Confluence Dashboard

h3. Expected Results
Activity stream does not show this calendar in the Activity Stream

h3. Actual Results
Showing Space Permissions:
!SpacePermissions.png|thumbnail! 
Calendar Restrictions:
!CalendarRestrictions.png|thumbnail! 
Activity Feed of another User:
!ActivityStream-AnotherUser.png|thumbnail! 
If the other user attempts to click on the Calendar, they're presented with a "Page Not Found" 
 
h3. Notes
Users who do not have access to this Space/Calendar are presented with a "Page Not Found"; this looks like the permissions are working and are preventing the user from viewing the Calendar, but they should not be able to see it at all; see [Restrict a Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcalcloud/restrict-a-calendar-909903929.html]

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Restricted Team Calendar Shows in Activity Stream

fields.description: We only have 100 product requirement documents but when going to the overview page, it takes 5–10 seconds to load while it displays "_Generating page properties report..._".
fields.summary: Product requirements page is really slow to "Generating page properties report..."

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a table on New Look Confluence, indents are reset when the user goes back in to edit the page
h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.1767.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence page (with New Look enabled)
# Create a 2x2 table.
# In a cell, add text, widen the columns enough to show the change, and add indent to the start of the line.
# Publish the page
# View the page, and see the indents are still there
# Edit the page, indents are reset. 
# If you publish the page you will see the indents are completely gone.

h3. Expected Results
Indents should not be removed
h3. Actual Results
Indents are removed upon editing the page
 
h3. Notes
This does not occur when New Look is disabled
h3.Workaround
No workaround under New Look, need to disable for user to work around issue.
fields.summary: Table indents reset  upon editing a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 1000.1767.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a table in Confluence with columns that are fixed width
The table should be quite wide so that it extends beyond the browser resolution
h3. Expected Results

The fixed width should be the same in both view and edit modes
h3. Actual Results

When editing the page, you will notice that carriage returns have been added in order to keep the table within the constraints of the browser window.
They do not match the ones when viewing the table outside of edit mode
h3. Workaround

No current workaround
fields.summary: Fixed width tables not honored in edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changes to the Text color in the global color scheme for Confluence for the sidebar does not change the color of the "my spaces" elements in the sidebar. They stay white, so using a white background renders them unreadable. This also makes them a different color than desired.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# add some spaces to your my spaces list.
# go to /wiki/admin/lookandfeel.action
# change the text color to black and the background color to white

h3. Expected Results

All text is black and readable.

h3. Actual Results
The white text of the space names in the "my spaces" list will be the same color as the background and will require mouse hovering to change the background to read each line.
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Use a background color other than white.
fields.summary: Color Schemes not applied to text  for "My Spaces" list elements.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Anonymous users see the "Edit With" option on Attachments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page inside a space with 'Anonymous can View' permissions
# Attach some files to it
# Go another browser/incognito windows as an anonymous user and navigate to that page/attachment

h3. Expected Results
You should only see options to download/share the file

h3. Actual Results
You see an option to Edit the file and you are offered to download the Atlassian Companion app.

(Even though, if the user downloads the app, he'll still be unable to edit it, as the pop-up will turn into a spinning wheel)
fields.summary: Anonymous users see the "Edit With" option on Attachments

fields.description:
It's almost impossible to work with a roadmap that has more than a few swim lanes or extends over a large date range.  Adding new bars or markers and then moving around the edit pane to get them to where they need to be is painful.  People in my company love the look of these roadmaps but struggle to edit them and often move to other tools instead.  

Full screen editing plus a bit more flexibility on setting the display width (see numerous overlapping suggestions) would be AMAZING.

Also perhaps a statement on the future of this macro.  Any space for improvements to it on your roadmap?
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner macro should have full screen edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Table of Contents display fewer headers if the page has a Include Page Macro linking to a page with a big table (400+ Rows)

h3. How to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Create a few Panel Macros
# Inside of each Panel, put Heading 1 text
# Create a Table of Contents Macro
# Publish the Page (The page displays all headers normally)
# Create another page
# Inside this page, insert a table (400+ Rows)
# Publish this Page
# On the first page, create a Include Page Macro pointing to the second page
# Move it to one of the panels - for example, put it under the panel which has the second heading on the Table of Contents Macro
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results
The Table of Contents should display all headings

h3. Actual Results
The Table of Contents display only headings above the Include Page Macro.
i.e.: If you have 7 Headers, and you put the Include Page macro under the 4th one, the Table of Contents will only display the first 4 headers.
fields.summary: Table of Contents display fewer headers if the page has a Include Page Macro linking to a page with a big table (400+ Rows)

fields.description: Would it be possible to add a dialog to request to the user if they would like to take a backup of their space (XML export) before they actually delete the space. Given the fact that Atlassian cannot perform restores as per [Data Storage FAQ|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/data-storage-faq-873871367.html] It may be a good idea to provide a last chance opportunity to make a backup of the space before it is gone forever.
fields.summary: Ask user if they want a backup before deleting a space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the page contains an [Anchor Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/anchors-139442.html] in a different [section|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-layouts-columns-and-sections-275188613.html] from the link pointing to the same, it will not work. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new page
# Create a new link to the Anchor. Through the *Add Hyperlink* button on the editor, go to *Advanced* and add a link to the anchor you've just created (#anchorname)
# Create a new Session
# Create an anchor with the name of the link in this different section. (example: anchorname)

h3. Expected Results
The link should redirect to the Anchor

h3. Actual Results
No actions happening 
h3. Notes
Tested with Confluence Old Look and New. The new Look only refreshes the page, but, it is not tied to this bug.

h3.Workaround
Remove the sections.
fields.summary: Anchors Do Not Work with Sections

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A customer using an iPad Pro to navigate Confluence has reported that the page does not render on the device; this was checked on both Mobile and Wifi

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* iPad Pro - iOS 10.3.3 
* Mozilla/5.0 (iPad; CPU OS 10_3_2 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/603.2.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/10.0 Mobile/14F8089 Safari/602.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Safari on an iPad Pro and navigate to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Page Renders

h3. Actual Results
Page does not fully render
 !Confluence-iPadPro.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Unable to repro on iPad Mini

h3.Workaround
Use an alternative browser, like Chrome, or the Confluence Mobile App (https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/confluence-cloud/id1006971684?mt=8)
fields.summary: Confluence Not Rendering In Safari on iPad Pro

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to use the Confluence Task Report macro to show only unassigned task.

Providing a method to filter these would improve the usability of Confluence tasks and the task report macro itself.
fields.summary: Allow filtering for unassigned tasks in Confluence task report macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unexpected error is causing JIRA Service Desk customers (Atlassian Account converted) to not be able to see JIRA issue/filter macros on Customer Portal knowledge bases as well as in Confluence directly.

h3. Environment

- Unicorn
- Vertigo

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h4. Requirements
Have the project's 'Knowledge Base' section check the box to allow anyone to read articles without a Confluence license.
Have *Allow any logged in users* to the 'Browse Projects' permission for the project tested.
Have a customer that was converted to Atlassian Account but has no accesses to JIRA or Confluence as a licensed user.
Have the space permissions set up to allow anonymous users to view the knowledge base space.

h4. On customer portal
# Have a knowledge base created using the JIRA issue macro listing issues from any project. (ie: The own JSD project)
# Log in to the customer portal with a Atlassian Account customer.
# Search for the knowledge base and open it.

h4. On Confluence
# Access the Confluence and look for the knowledge base space.
# Open a page that contains the JIRA issue macro.

h3. Expected Results

- Issues should be listed according to the filter on the JIRA issue/filter macro.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- When using \{\{include page}} macro, if you wish to include a page from another space, you must type \{\{SPACEKEY:Title}}
- You can either do this manually, or search for the page name and it will be filled in automatically by Confluence.
- When you attempt to type it out manually, the page is *Not Found*. If you *just* type the page name, it will be filled in.
- Even if you leave it as *Not Found*, and save the macro, it will work properly.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1748.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert Include Page Macro
# Start typing the name of a page that's in another space.
# Click on the desired page name, it will automatically be filled with \{\{SPACEKEY:Title}}
# Remove the Include Page Macro, try again, but this time, only manually typing \{\{SPACEKEY:Title}}
# Page is *Not Found*. Save Macro.
# Included page displays.

h3. Expected Results
- Page should be found with manually-typed \{\{SPACEKEY:Title}} and should preview properly.

h3. Actual Results
[^Recording #31.mp4]

h3.Workaround
Search for title of page and select the desired page.
fields.summary: Including page from another space 'Not Found'

fields.description: The first page the first user creates as part of the onboarding experience is created in the root of the space, rather than as a child of the homepage.  This is very confusing for that user.
fields.summary: First page is created as an orphan

fields.description:
The links under "My spaces" in the global sidebar do not respect the "text and icons" colour in the global colour scheme.

Instead, the link colour is determined based on the predominant colour detected in the site logo. This can lead to situations where the links are unreadable, like below:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Steps to reproduce:
1. Upload a white logo, leaving the default colour scheme unchanged
2. View the dashboard - observe that you have white links on a light grey background in the "My spaces" section

h2. Workaround
Change the site logo to a version that has a different predominant colour
fields.summary: Custom site logo colours affect the global sidebar links under "my spaces"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inserting an existing calendar to a page will result in a dummy calendar with no ability to add events.

At the same time, when I start typing for calendar suggestions, I am not presented with any existing calendars to choose from. The field is required but doesn't seem to validate anything. 

Finally, clicking the preview loads a dummy calendar in the macro editor. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and and click the insert more content menu and select *Insert ‘Team Calendars’ Macro*
# Type the name of the calendar and click save. 

h3. Expected Results
The page should display the existing calendar because it was specified by name
h3. Actual Results
The page displays a non working/dummy calendar - there is no add events button and double-clicking a day has no effect
 

h3.Workaround
# Go to an existing Calendar, click its menu and select *Embed*. 
# Edit any wiki page to again Insert ‘Team Calendars’ Macro
# Paste in the Emded link and remove everything except the id (it will be something like 0f090a4c-f9b9-4cbc-9699-b7b34d3a56ef) and save changes
# The correct calendar will be displayed, along with the Add Events button and double-click date feature.
fields.summary: Insert 'Team Calendars' Macro > Cannot Add Existing Calendar to a Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the "GET /rest/api/group/

\{groupName}

/member" REST API endpoint, The results are always the same set regardless of start parameter. This prevents cycling over the existing values as they are not paginated.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # find a group with a good number of members (30 is fine).
 # run a REST call to a URL like: "https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/group/confluence-users/member?limit=10&start=0" where "confluence-users" is the group that you want to use.
 # Run the same query with the "start" variable moved up to the next set (in this case "10")
 # Compare the users in the results.

h3. Expected Results

You see the next set of results in the list
h3. Actual Results

The users in the results set will be identical.
 The "Next" value will point to the same query with the start value incremented by the limit. This is true regardless of the start value as the system always populates with the same starting set of users.
 Only the first 200 members of the group can be shown as 200 is the maximum number of results that will return.
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Use the limit value up to 200 for groups with less than 200 users.
 There is no workaround for groups with more than 200 users.
fields.summary: Group "get members" endpoint for Confluence Cloud REST API does not paginate results

fields.description:

fields.description:
Confluence provides a feature to create user specific templates. There is a option to make that template as a global template. But not all teams in  a big cross functional organization needs the same set templates. There should be some way to export templates to other space

Alternately if there is a template repository and space administrator could choose  what all templates are required for project, will be useful

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Editor allows user to place line break within list only when the page is newly created.

 !Screenshot_2017-07-26_11_45_54.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence New Look and Feel ([ADG3|https://aui-cdn.atlassian.com/atlaskit/registry/])
** Verified with Confluence 1000.0.0-794c0b1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start creating new page
# Place bullet list and add items like "Foo" and "Bar"
# Confirm that you can delete heading bullet with keeping line break if you put new line right after the "Foo"
# Publish the page
# Start editing the page
# Confirm that now line break disappears together with the bullet by the same operation

h3. Expected Results
Heading bullet is supposed to be deletable with keeping line break.

h3. Actual Results
It's unable to let line break remain.

h3. Notes
* This occurs to the both style of bullet list {{<ul>}} and numbered list {{<li>}}

h3.Workaround
* Insert line breaks within list items using Shift + Enter, but only if the item starts with text. Put another way, you can't start a list item with a line break.
fields.summary: Unable to put line break within list after once page published

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing any page with text that has been indented with the indentation format tool, any previous indentations are removed and must be re-added manually every time the page is edited.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a page with text (I suggest some lorem ipsum)
# highlight some of the text and then hit the "indent" button in the toolbar to indent the text
# Publish the page (you will see the indented text is still indented.
# Edit the page.

h3. Expected Results

The Indentations are preserved and appear in the editor.

h3. Actual Results
All text that was indented this way will no longer show the indents.
Publishing the page like this will remove the indentations on all the text indented this way.
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Editing a page with indented text strips the indentations

fields.description:
When viewing attachments (either via the More...–> Attachments page, using the Attachments macro, or otherwise), the ability to see what pages reference an attachment is vital. Currently, when using an [Inclusion Library approach|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/archives/organisation_is] for documentation in Confluence, it is not possible to see what pages an attachment is associated with. It is not possible to tell if updating/renaming/modifying an attachment will have a subsequent impact to other documentation using the image from the IL.

For example, when viewing the Page Information for a given page in Confluence, I am able to view the Incoming Links for that page. The same functionality for attachments is what I'm looking for.
fields.summary: Ability to View On What Pages an Attachment is Used

fields.description:
If the user is watching a Calendar, a notification about changes will be sent through the email, pointing the current Calendar that you are watching: 

{quote}
You're receiving this notification because you're watching the following:
Calendar name with link included
{quote}

This is a suggestion to also send the URL for https://instancename/wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action which will list all the Calendars that the user is watching. 

The reason for this suggestion: By clicking on the *Calendar name* from the notification, it will redirect you to the Calendar. There, even if the user clicks to *Unwatch* the Calendar, the same will still receive notifications due to needing to go to https://instancename/wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action and unwatch there as well.
fields.summary: Add Team Calendars URL in Email Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk customer sees spinning wheel when accessing direct link to internal KB overview page or 'pages' page.  They are also unable to see the page tree to navigate from one page to another within the space.
 Individual links to specific knowledge base articles still work.
 This is only an issue if the customer has an Atlassian Account, but does not have a Confluence license.
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create Service Desk Project and Link with an existing KB
 # Go to Project Setting > Portal Settings > Add direct link to the *Introduction text* eg.
{noformat}
[*Internal Knowledge Base*|https://<instancename>/wiki/spaces/internalkb]{noformat}

 # Create customer
 # Log in as customer
 # On the portal, Click on *Internal Knowledge Base***
 # Then try navigating to specific article.

h3. Actual Result

KB overview page displays spinning wheel
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Page tree is missing

!image-2017-07-25-14-01-32-514.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Expected Result

KB displays the overview content correctly
h3. Workaround
 # Provide direct link into pages
 # Ask support to rollback to old look
fields.summary: Service Desk customer unable to browse their knowledge base when using the new look Confluence.
